by Saturnalia on April 22nd, 2009
I imagine a whole number of reasons, ignorance, lack of understanding, fear.
For some working for minimum was never an option as they could have been born into a privileged household.
I for one have grown up working minimum wage jobs, its the reason i was able to move out of my home, attend university and get a degree. Im still in University doing my masters and working part-time, it pays the rent and the bills.
I look at family members who have worked minumum wage jobs all their lives to provide for their families,put kids through school,enjoy life and i am proud and grateful to them.
I see some of my friends who grew up not having to work or even still receiving handouts from their parents while studying and not even looking for a job. The idea of a minumum wage job repulses them. Complete ignorance.
If they worked a minimum wage job they would propbably appreciate what they had a bit more.
I hate to say it but in this current economic climate we will see people choosing jobs that before they wouldnt have even considered.
Comments
Just an afterthought, i'd rather get by and have a great sense of job satisfaction rather than earn a great salary and be miserable in the process.
